thread.title: Slaven Bilic backs in-form West Ham striker Andy Carroll to earn England recall ahead of Germany clash
thread.title_full: Slaven Bilic backs in-form West Ham striker Andy Carroll to earn England recall ahead of Germany clash

author: rforrester
title: Slaven Bilic backs in-form West Ham striker Andy Carroll to earn England recall ahead of Germany clash
text:
Three Lions awaits Slaven Bilic backs in-form West Ham striker Andy Carroll to earn England recall ahead of Germany clash 
Hammers star could add to his nine caps after scoring four goals in his last four games By Pat Sheehan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SLAVEN BILIC has backed Andy Carroll for an England recall — saying he is so good he could even lift world champs Germany. 
West Ham boss Bilic has overseen hitman Carroll’s return to top form. PA:Press Association 2 Slaven Bilic believes Andy Carroll’s recent form is worthy of an England call-up 
Bilic reckons nine-cap Carroll has done enough to earn a place when Gareth Southgate announces his next Three Lions squad to face Germany. 
Keep up to date with ALL the West Ham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
He said: “Andy would help any team. He’d help the German team, Andy would help the Croatia team, the Spanish team. 
“Andy is very difficult, if not impossible to mark in the box. He’s great in the air, very physical, has a great touch — he has all the attributes that are required for a top player.” Andy Carroll has won nine caps for his country scoring two goals Related news Controversial Argentine Diego Maradona handed new FIFA role... to clean corruption from football COSTA NOT OFFEE Diego Costa WILL stay at Chelsea next term and 'everything is calm now', says boss Antonio Conte BRAZIL IS THE NUTS Forest appoint Gary Brazil as boss until the end of the season... but still have eyes on Nigel Clough Ant's ultimatum Antoine Griezmann will SNUB Manchester United - if Jose Mourinho's men fail to qualify for the Champions League SKIP, SKIP, HOORAY Tottenham boss hails Hugo Lloris, Dele Alli, Eric Dier, Harry Kane and Christian Eriksen - his team of leaders BACK OFF Arsene Wenger warns his critics not to tell him how to run HIS club as anger continues to mount at the Emirates NIGHT AT THE ROOSEUM Wayne Rooney to be honoured with his own exhibition at the Manchester United museum Copa load of this Barcelona to appeal Luis Suarez's two-match ban which will rule him out of the Copa del Rey final Eyes on the prize Anthony Martial posts holiday pic with girlfriend Melanie Da Cruz... but he's back in training ahead of the Watford clash ANOTHER ONE'S OFF Juventus agree £8.5m sale of Brazilian midfielder Hernanes to Chinese Super League outfit Hebei China Fortune BE on GUARD Man City boss Pep Guardiola planning £200m spending spree with ELEVEN first-team stars to be axed FOWL MOOD Sam Allardyce escapes Palace nightmare with stars at book launch... and a meal at Nando's Southampton 1-3 West Ham : Hammers bounce back to beat Saints at St Mary's 
Carroll, 28, has a slight groin strain but Bilic expects him to be fit to face West Brom tomorrow. 
Bilic added: “It is not something major.”
